content.raw:
> In theory the default OLD policy value should provide backward compatibility, but instead in this case the `OLD` setting of the policy is not working, while explicitly setting the `NEW` setting solves both problems.

I tried to check a   bit the related CMake PRs and  issue, and based on [https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/20101](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/20101) and  [https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/merge\_requests/4146/diffs](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/merge_requests/4146/diffs) , I guess that it is  possible that even setting the policy as done in [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3201](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3201) , the linking will fail on CMake 3.16.4/3.16.5 . As CMake  3.17 is going to be released, I guess that if anyone is having this problem, the suggested solution is just to use either CMake 3.15 or 3.17, avoiding CMake 3.16 .  

‌
content.html:
In theory the default OLD policy value should provide backward compatibility, but instead in this case the OLD setting of the policy is not working, while explicitly setting the NEW setting solves both problems.

I tried to check a bit the related CMake PRs and issue, and based on https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/20101 and https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/merge_requests/4146/diffs , I guess that it is possible that even setting the policy as done in #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3201 , the linking will fail on CMake 3.16.4/3.16.5 . As CMake 3.17 is going to be released, I guess that if anyone is having this problem, the suggested solution is just to use either CMake 3.15 or 3.17, avoiding CMake 3.16 .

‌
